main event: A civilian in White Plains, New York spotted a single star-like object that hovered motionless in the sky for 2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as being approximately the same size and appearance as a star.
The object moved from southwest to northeast before disappearing into clouds.
The witness indicated the object may have been an aircraft or satellite, though they sounded sincere in their report.
Weather conditions at the time included scattered clouds, with winds ranging from 10 to 40 knots at various altitudes.
No photographs or physical evidence were obtained, and no interception or identification actions were taken.
